item.title: SAROSH KRISHAN
item.description:
Cell phone: +92-334-3266754

Email: saroshanish@gmail.com

Experience:

June 2020 – August 2020

Internship at TUKL Research Lab, NUST Islamabad

June 2019 – August 2019

Internship at Data Communication and Control (DCC), Karachi

Education:

Bachelor’s in Computer Science 2019 – Present
National University of Science and Technology (NUST)
Current CGPA: 3.90 (2 Semesters)

Projects:

• Created a failure of a chess bot, using the deep learning python library Keras, during the internship at TUKL in 2020.

• Team member for a side-scrolling 2D platformer, named SKARTA with original character design and gameplay features, in 2020.

• Team member for a fully functional chess game capable of user interaction from print statements in C, in 2019.

• Team member for a line following robot using LDRs and an Arduino circuit, during the internship at DCC in 2018.

Computer Related Skills:

• Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
• Python.
• Java.
• C++.

Hobbies & Interests:

• Chess
• Rubik’s Cubes
• Video Games
• Writing and Poetry
• Music (Piano, Guitar, Ukulele)
• Table Tennis
• Coin Collection
• Making People Laugh

Professional Strengths:

• Good presentation skills and leadership qualities.
• Punctual, flexible, and adaptable.
• Dedicated and hard working.

item.title: How I created this Website
item.description:
I used a tutorial on Youtube to learn how to use Hugo and Git to generate a static website with pre existing themes and used github pages to host the site.
Building A Website Using Hugo

item.title: How I created the Operating System
item.description:
I first watched the youtube videos referenced in the assignment description to understand how to use VS Code, Docker, QEMU, make and assembly code to create an OS from scratch to display the text “OK”.
Write Your Own 64-bit Operating System Kernel #1

Next, I learned how to run C code on the newly created OS through the second video referenced in the assignment description. I then used C code to print a giant “SEECS” onto the QEMU simulation.
Write Your Own 64-bit Operating System Kernel #2

This is the link to the GitHub repository containing all the code for the Operating System I created.
OS Assignment
